title: Redwood National and State Parks: Fees & Passes
body: Explore This Park    Plan Your Visit     Basic Information     Fees & Passes              Fees & Passes       Entrance/Day-Use   National Park: Redwood National Park is free to visit! California State Parks: Jedediah Smith, Del Norte Coast, and Prairie Creek Redwoods state parks collect day-use fees at campground entrance stations.   Fee-Free Days All park entrance/day-use fees within Redwood National and State Parks are waived on the following days:  Martin Luther King Jr. Day, January 18, 2016 Presidents Day weekend, February 13-15, 2016 National Park Week’s opening weekend, April 16-17, 2016 National Park Service’s 100th birthday, August 25, 2016 National Public Lands Day, September 24, 2016 Veterans Day, November 11, 2016  Camping  Campgrounds: Fees ($35) are required for camping at all campgrounds; reservations are strongly recommended for camping at the Jedediah Smith, Mill Creek, and Elk Prairie campgrounds between May and late September. Reservations must be made at least 48 hours in advance by calling 1-800-444-7275 or online at ReserveAmerica.com. Backcountry: Free permits are required for overnight use of all designated backcountry camps (exception: Gold Bluffs Beach/$5 per person, per night), available at Kuchel Visitor Center,  and Hiouchi Visitor Center.  Education Facilities The Howland Hill Outdoor School and Wolf Creek Education Center are available by reservation only. Fees apply.
